name: David Letterman
monologue: Charlie Sheen sold out Radio City Music Hall twice. Winning! Now he has two weeks to come up with a show. Nervous!

name: Conan O'Brian
monologue: The Fox network is considering giving a talk show to Charlie Sheen. It would be the only show with a 30-hour monologue.

name: Conan O'Brian
monologue: Sarah Palin visited the Wailing Wall in Israel. There was an awkward moment when she asked, “So this keeps the Mexicans out?”

name: Conan O'Brian
monologue: The strikes on Libya are costing $100 million. Or, in Moammar Gadhafi terms, five Beyonce concerts.

name: Conan O'Brian
monologue: There was an essay question on the SATs this year about reality TV. In other news, China has won.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: It was raining so hard in Los Angeles that Charlie Sheen changed his slogan from “winning” to “drowning.”

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Remember when President Obama said we can’t fight two wars and vowed to change our policy? Well, he did. Now we’re fighting three wars.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Obama said we will send economic aid to Libya to help the Libyan people reach their dreams. And if that works, they’ll try it here.

name: Jay Leno
monologue: Cocaine was found at the Kennedy Space Center. It’s one small step for man, and one giant leap for Charlie Sheen.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: AT&T; has decided to buy T-Mobile for $39 billion. It was a tough call for AT&T;, but then again, every call is a tough call for AT&T.;

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Optometrists say the new Nintendo 3DS can spot lazy eyes in children. It can also spot lazy optometrists.

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: Sarah Palin visited Israel. She says she likes all religions, “whether they celebrate Christmas or Jewish.”

name: Jimmy Fallon
monologue: A new study found that elderly people lack the coordination to talk on cell phones while crossing the street. But it’s still really fun to watch them try.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: It rained really hard in California. It’s God’s way of trying to flush out the “Real Housewives of Orange County.”

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: It rained on the L.A. Marathon. Fortunately, unlike other marathons, in the L.A. Marathon you’re allowed to drive your car.

name: Jimmy Kimmel
monologue: An Ethiopian man won the marathon and broke all the records. He had never run in a race and he had a bad stomach going into it. In fact, he didn’t even know he was in a marathon.
